knimeNode.name: Java Snippet (Heiko)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Calculates a new columns based on java code snippets.

intro.p: This node allows you to execute arbitrary java code to create a new columns or to replace an existing ones. Enter the java code in the text area.

fullDescription.option: The list contains the columns that are available in the input table. Double click any of the column names to insert the respective field in the expression editor. It will replace your current selection or simply insert at the current caret position.

The list contains the flow variables that are currently available at the node input. Double clicking any of the entries will insert the respective identifier at the current cursor position (replacing the selection, if any).

Enter your java code here. You can access input columns or flow variables by defining them in the Snippet fields for input. A second way is to use the methods getCell(name, type) or getFlowVariable(name, type) where name is the name of the input column or the flow variable, respectively. You can use the following values for the type parameter.
String : String (f)
Int : Integer (f)
Double : Double (f)
Long : Long
Boolean : Boolean
Date : java.util.Date
Calendar : java.util.Calendar
XML : org.w3c.document
(f) These Types can be used for flow variables.
Please define output columns and flow variables by adding columns to Snippet fields for output. Values assigned to those field in the snippet text area will show up at the output.
The snippet allows to define custom global variables and custom imports.
Define system input fields for the snippet text area. Every field will be populated with the data of the defined input during execution.
Define output, either columns or flow variables.

ports.outPort: Input table with an additional or replaced columns.
